reviews.review_msg: SFU is facing such a shortage of professors and instructors that they've had to hire someone like this to teach a class. It's very hard to understand her because of her accent and the way she speaks. On top of that, she is very arrogant and doesn't seem to have teaching skills at all. I don't know what I'm supposed to learn from her..

This professor is incompetent. She can't teach partly because she mumbles when she talks so you can't even hear the words she's saying and she's always vague when you ask her questions. She always reads of the slides and her feedback is not helpful. You could not attend class and just study on your own, that was more effective.
Doesn't have sufficient English skills to teach. Very arrogant, has poor listening and speaking skills, and doesn't know how to speak to people respectfully.

Yuri is one of the worst professors I've had at SFU. Her slides are straight from the textbook with no added insight, so attending lectures feels pointless. She mumbles through explanations, and if you ask for clarification, she just stares at you. Many case studies were irrelevant, and her exams demand exact answers with no flexibility. Avoid!
Never take it with her. She does not respond to emails all semester, does not accept sick notes if you can't come to class. JUST AVOID HER!
Just don't take it with her

Avoid at all cost. What everyone is saying here is true. She mumbles too much in a super quiet voice and doesn't teach anything! Class asked her what chapters to study for the exam and she just laughed at us and told us she wont be telling us??? Odd way of teaching and doesn't provide any help when you reach out.

Avoid avoid avoid. She makes lecture a complete waste of time but mandatory for participation marks. She is passive aggressive and will make faces at you if you don't say exactly what she's thinking during discussion. She reads her slides off in 2x speed and never actually provides valuable information for learning. Worst prof ever!
She mumbles when talking in her lectures, and when you ask her to repeat herself, she makes a weird face and talks even quieter. Overall a really bad prof but her exams weren't that hard.
dont take a class with her i beg you, she is so terrible, avoid at all costs. the good reviews about her are prolly just her writing them. theres nothing good about this prof. dont take her class

Horrible prof. No structure at all. Changes things on a whim like how participation is graded. Gives long breaks then speedruns the slides like crazy. Good luck understanding anything. Re case studies, u r given 1 mark for each valid point brought up but she didn't tell us that before. Some of us focused on quality over quantity of idea n got low

DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASS WITH YURI. The worse prof at SFU. Mumbles & then makes faces when you ask her to repeat her self. During lectures she reads through the slides at warp speed. Has incredibly confusing grading criteria & doesn't explain it when you ask. Does not care about students and is unaccessible outside of class. Avoid her at all costs!

She was the best professor I've ever had. As a leading researcher in her field, she brought high-quality research into the classroom. She is incredibly inspiring and genuinely cares about her students' success. She goes out of her way to help in every possible way, and having a professor like that motivates you to give your best effort.
pretty mid

The most unorganized professor I've had at SFU. Late for 95% of lectures by 15-20 mins and would take another 20-30 mins to start because she didn't have an adapter to connect to the projector. Slides are a summary of the textbook, never replies to emails, very vague assignment criteria. The class is a big mess and she has no idea what she's doing.

Midterms were pretty easy, participation was marked tough, and the grading for the final projects was ridiculous - average was 93% for both classes I took with her, it was as if she didn't even read them. It was pretty tough to differentiate yourself grade-wise and her lectures were extremely dry. I dreaded going to her class, do not recommend.

Excellent.Very organized and very approachable. She really wants her students to do well. She is also very good with emails and replies within 12 hours. In order to do well, you will need to read the book though, since the tests are based on on the textbook. Also consider attendance as mandatory and make sure you participate in class discussions!
Course was  pointless.  nice prof but not very  engaging.
She's great! Really knows what she is talking about, and went out of her way to e-mail me about something that I needed clarification on...
I really enjoyed her teaching style. She is very approachable and organized.   I learned a lot about Int'l Business that I can apply to my own field.

This course has a lot to do with international business, politics, trade policy and etc.  If you are not interested in these topics, you will have a hard time.  Evan is a very engaging and knowledgeable business person, not just an instructor.  He doesn't really care about grades and hands out very high marks as long as you try.
He is very organized and his course is pretty boring to take with

PRO: Professor Remya is nice. I personally liked her lectures.

CON: Participation matters and you hv to speak at least once in class.

Overall course structure and instructions given were confusing + all over the place. 

Nothing was marked until end of the sem.
If you take it with her, make sure you ask questions after class for clarifications.

Was not impressed with this professor. She marked participation at a higher chunk of the final grade at 20%  than group projects at 15% each, the instructions were confusing or nonexistent, she lied about the structure of the final exam, and we did not receive any grades until a week before the final. Avoid taking BUS 346 with her if you can.

Remya is a nice person, very caring. However, I doubt her course being the best, as the structure was very unorganized (including her syllabus), communication was inconsistent and assignment guides were very unclear. Exams were in very confusing and messy format. If she puts more time on restructuring the course, it would be much better.

I'm in my final semester at SFU and taken over 120 CR. This is the worst class I have ever taken.

Instructions are unclear and given inconsistently on canvas, emails, verbal. Often must all be considered together.

ALL grading left until the end of sem. 

Participation was haphazardly marked but also worth 20%, term projects were only 15%.

AVOID!
Same goes for me. I do feel a little bad bc she does seem like a nice lady but this class is the most unorganized ever. Didn't know what I had in this class until 2 days ago

I have to agree with what others say, nice lady, but the course itself is very unorganized. Spent around 4 lectures on presentation only, Q&A is where your participation marks will be counted. You can imagine the course contents are similar to social studies 10 from high school.

How is participation worth 20% while the case report + presentation is worth 15%? Also, her TA checks your participation by tracking your name tag, but if she can't read your name tag, then your participation's gone. Grades are released very late, and very unorganized. Avoid this absolute tuition sucker course, take it with another prof. AVOID #2

I wonder how this prof is allowed to teach. She gives the most confusing directions, is extremely unclear with her criteria, and seems to want students to fail. Its the end of the semester and none of us have received any marks so I could end up with an A+ or an F and wouldn't be shocked by either. SFU should look into this.

Taking this class with her is like having a tree teach you global business (the tree doesn't teach you anything). She's got no idea whats going on and neither do the students. She doenst explain what shes asking for (sent out presentation instructions 2 weeks after presentations started), and hasn't marked anything since the semester started. AVOID

Remya is one of the most confused professors I have ever seen. She doesnt provide clear instructions for anything and cant answer questions about assignment because even she's confused about it. It's almost the end of the semester, and we havent received a single grade back. Please take this class with anyone else to save the confusion.
No Comments

=) nice prof. dont take what he says too personally and you will have a good time in his class. sometimes,  he pushes the limits when what he says is not funny anymore, but he teaches well and class is interesting

hated him so much. Participation worth alot yet his standard is arbituary. Not only had to participate, but also you have to say something that suits his taste. If you aren't a good at shoe shining, AVOID HIM AT ALL COST

Get off your soapbox. If you want to score participation marks with this prof, then you better start sucking up and hanging around after class to be his friend. Doesn't respect and accept other perspectives. Unbelievable for a prof who seems to have absolutely no field experience and is probably one of the laziest profs.
funniest man at SFU

Chang is very approachable and runs a very informative lecture. English is not his first language, so it's important to listen closely in class. Two exams with some tricky MC and short answer questions. Required reading, attendance, and active participation every class are necessary for B+ or higher.

I took his course when I was an exchange student at SFU.  He was the most respectful prof among those who have taught me.  He was intellectual and provided extra efforts to students.  He was also a generous grader.  I wish I had him in my home university.
Fun

Pretty dry class. His tests were tricky and quite a lot of your mark is based on valuable course participation. I found the class pretty boring. He tried to make some of it interesting, but not most of the time. He was not very helpful and sometimes kind of confusing. He knows everyone by name though, which is nice.
heavy heavy workload

The professor has a major attitude issue. He always has this negative tone to him and it gets very tiring listening to it. He is very stuck up, you definitely feel the power distance with this guy. The quizzes are fair but I wouldn't take him ever again, I want a caring prof. The quizzes are fair if you go through the lecture and book materials.
Very few times have I met profs that truly care about their classes, and their students. BUS346 was NOT easy by any means, but an incredible prof can make all the difference.

Prof Ufimtseva was amazing and it was a pleasure coming to class day in and day out. Overall, the structure of the course was very well thought out and you could see that a lot of effort was put into its organization. Very kind and thoughtful towards all students.

The content of this class is extremely dry and the lectures are very long. The group project portion was 40%, so it was pretty heavy. Anastasia makes this class the best it can be and genuinely cares about her students wellbeing. 10/10 recommend taking it with her.
Jing is a lovely prof! She has very clear lectures and her exams are right out of the book!

I think she is very sweet and nice.  Knows the international business stuffs well and responsive to suggestions.  Midterms are long but not bad, and no finals. Participation is a huge thing in addition to presentations. Overall, I think she is great to take the course with and course is quite fun!

She knows her international business well, but she is not cut out as a teacher. She simply does not know how to teach, is very unclear on the midterms in my opinion. If you're a robot, take this class, but if you're a regular student, try to avoid her as a professor.

Really good professor, I enjoyed her classes, she tries to engage people in discussing concepts in class, which I found very fun. Exams are all short answers and very long, but class average are generally pretty high75-80%. Her markings were fair, very responsive to questions and emails. Very good prof overall

i hate her, she makes the class too demanding! she's an assistant professor, and she tries too hard. She's one of those profs that thinks their students is only taking this one class, and loads you up on readings/ cases/ presentations. Participation counts for way too much.

found her class easy but was surprised to find out that i only got a C+. midterms (there are 2) aren't that hard...mostly about the concepts. However, they were pretty long. Course is quite heavy in terms of the load. I did not learn anything new from the course. dont recommend taking her
